sen.j: 持組(もちぐみ)は江戸幕府の組織。
sen.e: Mochigumi was an organization in the Edo bakufu.

sen.j: 将軍の弓 (武器)や火縄銃を持つ部隊と言う意味であるが、その実態は将軍直衛の弓･鉄砲隊である。
sen.e: Mochigumi meant troops for carrying the arrows (weapons) and matchlock guns of a shogun; actually they were arrow and musket troops under shogun's direct orders.
Mochigumi literally means troops for carrying the arrows (weapons) and matchlock guns of a shogun, but in practice they were arrow and musket troops under shogun's direct orders.
sen.cmt: 意味と実態の違いをわかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Mochigumi literally means troops for carrying the arrows (weapons) and matchlock guns of a shogun, but in practice they were arrow and musket troops under shogun's direct orders.

sen.j: 持筒組と持弓組があり、前者は鉄砲隊である。
sen.e: Mochigumi was composed of firearms unit and shooting arrows unit.
Mochigumi was composed of firearms unit and shooting arrows unit.

sen.j: 時代によって増減するが寛永九年は持筒組四組、持弓組は三組であった。
sen.e: Although the number of unit varied according to the times, mochigumi was composed of 4 firearms units and 3 shooting arrows units in 1627.
Although the number of unit varied according to the times, mochigumi was composed of 4 firearms units and 3 shooting arrows units in 1632.

sen.j: 各組は持之頭(持筒頭･持弓頭)の元、与力10人･同心50人で構成された。
sen.e: Each unit included 10 of yoriki and 50 of doshin (police constable) led by commander of each unit.
